name: proteins_api_get_protein
description: Get comprehensive protein information from Proteins API by UniProt accession. Returns protein annotations, sequences, features, and cross-references. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

oneOf.description: Single protein information (when single accession provided) including annotations, sequences, features, and cross-references. Contains fields: accession, id, proteinExistence, info, organism, secondaryAccession, protein, gene, comments, features, dbReferences, references, etc.
List of protein results (when multiple accessions provided in batch). Each item contains 'accession', 'status', 'data', and 'url' fields.

count.description: Number of results returned. Only present for batch operations (when multiple accessions provided).

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

name: proteins_api_get_variants
description: Get variation data for a protein including ClinVar, COSMIC, and other variant annotations. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. Note: Variations endpoint may not be available for all proteins. If this returns 404, use proteins_api_get_protein instead which includes variant information. Returns variant information with clinical significance and population frequencies.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

status.description: Execution status ('success' or 'error'). Returns 'error' if variations endpoint is not available for the protein.

data.description: List of protein variations with clinical significance and population frequencies. Only present when status is 'success'.

count.description: Number of variations returned. Only present when status is 'success' (single request) or for batch operations.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

error.description: Error message explaining why variations are not available. Only present when status is 'error' (single request).

note.description: Suggestion for alternative approach when variations endpoint is not available. Only present when status is 'error' (single request) or for batch operations with partial failures.

name: proteins_api_get_proteomics
description: Get proteomics data for a protein including mass spectrometry evidence, PTM sites, and expression data. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. Note: This tool extracts proteomics-related data from the main protein endpoint (the separate proteomics endpoint is not available). Returns PTM comments, modified residues, and related features.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: Proteomics data including PTM comments, modified residues, and related features.

count.description: Number of proteomics data items returned. For batch operations, this is the number of successful results.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

name: proteins_api_get_epitopes
description: Get epitope sequences for a protein. Returns B-cell and T-cell epitope information with antigenicity predictions. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. Note: This tool extracts epitope-related data from the main protein endpoint (the separate epitopes endpoint is not available). Returns immunology comments and epitope features if present.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: Epitope sequences and annotations including immunology comments and epitope features.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

name: proteins_api_search
description: Search proteins in Proteins API. Returns search results matching the query. Note: The Proteins API search endpoint may have limitations. For reliable protein search, consider using ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' instead. This tool attempts to search by name or accession, but may not work for all query types.

query.description: Search query (e.g., protein name, gene name, organism). Internally converted to 'q' parameter for Proteins API.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

status.description: Execution status ('success' or 'error'). Returns 'error' if search endpoint is not available or query is invalid.

data.description: Search results containing protein entries matching the query. Only present when status is 'success'.

count.description: Number of results returned. Only present when status is 'success'.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

error.description: Error message explaining why search failed. Only present when status is 'error'.

suggestion.description: Suggestion for alternative approach when search endpoint is not available. Only present when status is 'error'.

name: proteins_api_get_genome_mappings
description: Get reference genome mappings for a protein using the Proteins API. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. This extracts genome-related cross-references (Ensembl, RefSeq, EMBL, GenBank) from the main protein endpoint, which may contain genomic location information. Note: The separate genome endpoint is not available, so this tool extracts genome-related cross-references from the main protein data. Use UniProt or EBI Search (domain='uniprot') to find accessions such as 'P05067' or 'P04637'.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: List of genome mapping records for the requested protein.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

name: proteins_api_get_features
description: Get detailed sequence features for a protein, including domains, regions, motifs, modified residues, and other annotated features. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. Note: This tool extracts features from the main protein endpoint (the separate features endpoint is not available). Returns all sequence feature annotations for the protein.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: List of sequence feature annotations for the requested protein.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

name: proteins_api_get_xrefs
description: Get cross-references for a protein from the Proteins API, including links to other databases (Ensembl, PDB, Reactome, EMBL, RefSeq, etc.). Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. Note: This tool extracts cross-references from the main protein endpoint (the separate xrefs endpoint is not available). Returns database cross-reference records.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: List of cross-reference records for the requested protein.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

name: proteins_api_get_comments
description: Get functional annotations and comments for a protein from the Proteins API. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. This includes curated comments on function, subcellular location, disease involvement, and other annotations. Note: This tool extracts comments from the main protein endpoint (the separate comments endpoint is not available). Returns all functional annotation comments.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: List of comment/annotation records for the requested protein.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.

name: proteins_api_get_publications
description: Get publications associated with a protein from the Proteins API. Supports batch operations: pass a list of accessions or comma-separated string to retrieve multiple proteins in parallel. Returns literature references linked to the UniProt accession, including PubMed IDs and citation details. Note: This tool extracts publications from the main protein endpoint (the separate publications endpoint is not available). Returns all publication references.

accession.description: UniProt protein accession(s). Can be a single accession (e.g., 'P05067'), comma-separated string (e.g., 'P05067,P04637'), or list (e.g., ['P05067', 'P04637']). Use UniProt search or ebi_search_domain with domain='uniprot' to find valid accessions.

format.description: Response format. JSON is recommended for most use cases.

data.description: List of publication records associated with the requested protein.

url.description: Final request URL used for the API call.

fallback_used.description: Indicates whether data was extracted from the main protein endpoint (true) or returned from a separate endpoint (false).

note.description: Additional information about how the data was retrieved.

total_requested.description: Total number of accessions requested. Only present for batch operations.

errors.description: List of errors for failed accessions. Only present for batch operations when some accessions fail.
